column4: Hello? I'm getting ready to move my Wubi install to its own partition. I've been deleting stuff from my 134GB data partition in preparation. It has 28% of its space free now, and I've defragmented it several times. But I can't get data to move away from the end of the partition. Is it safe to resize the partition anyway?
Read the faq on the wubi wiki, moving that lvm wubi install may be a problem....  I would rather see you go into ubuntu, and save your /home to a usb
Do you have any backup of ubuntu?
no, not right now. My iPod's battery is dead, and until it comes back, I've nowhere to back it up.
I would suggest that be your priority
I wont use or recommend wubi, but since you have, I suggest you read the faq and learn all you can about what it is and how to deal with it
If you are talking about using windows to burn the wubi install.. I think you are asking for trouble
please tell me why you think it's a bad idea.
have you read the wubi wiki faq
Chill, you say you dont want to be rude, but that is exactly what you are being
/join #compiz to find tweeks that suit your hardware
Explain what you did in detail to get the best help undoing it
Well, I tried to install a driver using ndisgtk. Ndisgtk then froze up. I force quitted it, and now both ndisgtk and ndiswrapper -l just freeze.
Please just ask in the channel and be patient..
